locations.name: Rudee Inlet
locations.summary: Rudee Inlet offers good kayak fishing conditions on Saturday. Anglers will benefit from the low tide at 6:49 AM, transitioning to incoming water, and manageable WNW winds at 7-9 mph. The water temperature is a cool 55°F, suggesting fish may be in deeper channels or structure.

locations.name: Rudee Inlet
locations.summary: Conditions are okay for Sunday, with a low tide at 7:38 AM offering a good incoming tide period within the fishing window. However, winds increase slightly to 8-12 mph from the NW, which could create some chop near the inlet mouth. The water temperature is a chilly 54°F, requiring warm gear and slower presentations.

locations.name: 64th Street Boat Ramp
locations.summary: This location offers good conditions with sheltered bay waters and manageable 7-9 mph WNW winds. A low tide around 7:15 AM provides a favorable incoming tide period for targeting speckled trout and red drum. The water temperature is 55°F, typical for mid-November.

hover_facts.current_speed: data unavailable (slower in back bays, stronger near inlets)
extra_notes: good for red drum, speckled trout

locations.name: 64th Street Boat Ramp
locations.summary: Sunday's conditions are okay, with a low tide around 8:00 AM providing a productive incoming tide through the morning. Winds at 8-12 mph from the NW might create some chop on larger sections of the bay, but sheltered areas should still be fishable. The 54°F water temperature indicates fish will be seeking deeper pockets or sun-warmed shallows.

hover_facts.current_speed: data unavailable (slower in back bays, stronger near inlets)
extra_notes: potential for calm waters despite NW wind

locations.name: Lynnhaven Boat Ramp
locations.summary: Lynnhaven Bay offers good conditions for Saturday with a low tide at 7:25 AM, providing an excellent incoming tide period within the fishing window. The 7-9 mph WNW winds are manageable for kayaking, allowing access to the bay's productive oyster beds. Water temperature is 55°F, typical for fall.

locations.name: Lynnhaven Boat Ramp
locations.summary: Sunday is an okay day for Lynnhaven, with a low tide at 8:14 AM setting up a strong incoming current for the morning. Winds increase slightly to 8-12 mph from the NW, which can make exposed areas choppy, but anglers can find good protection within the bay. The water temperature is 54°F, indicating cooler fishing.

extra_notes: good protection from NW winds in certain areas of the bay

locations.name: CBBT First Island
locations.summary: Kayak fishing at CBBT First Island is okay on Saturday, with a low tide at 7:06 AM providing favorable incoming current around the structure. However, winds at 8-12 mph from the WNW can make conditions choppy and challenging in this exposed location. The water temperature is a cool 53°F, requiring proper cold-weather gear.

locations.name: CBBT First Island
locations.summary: Sunday is a bad day for kayak fishing at CBBT First Island due to high winds. Sustained NW winds of 10-15 mph, coupled with strong currents of 0.5-1.5 knots, will create dangerous conditions for kayaks. The cold water temperature of 52°F further increases safety risks.

extra_notes: high winds make kayak fishing very challenging and unsafe

locations.name: HRBT Norfolk Side
locations.summary: Kayak fishing at HRBT Norfolk Side is okay on Saturday, with a low tide at 7:47 AM providing a good incoming tide period for fishing around the bridge structure. Winds at 8-12 mph from the WNW will make conditions moderately choppy and require careful navigation. The water temperature is 53°F, typical for fall.

locations.name: HRBT Norfolk Side
locations.summary: Sunday is a bad day for kayak fishing at HRBT Norfolk Side due to elevated winds. NW winds of 10-15 mph, combined with strong currents of 0.5-1.0 knots, will create hazardous conditions for kayaks. The cold water temperature of 52°F further exacerbates safety concerns.

extra_notes: high winds make kayak fishing very challenging and unsafe

locations.name: HRBT Hampton Side
locations.summary: Kayak fishing at HRBT Hampton Side is okay on Saturday, with a low tide at 7:47 AM providing a good incoming tide period for fishing around the bridge structure. Winds at 8-12 mph from the WNW will make conditions moderately choppy and require careful navigation. The water temperature is 53°F, typical for fall.

locations.name: HRBT Hampton Side
locations.summary: Sunday is a bad day for kayak fishing at HRBT Hampton Side due to elevated winds. NW winds of 10-15 mph, combined with strong currents of 0.5-1.0 knots, will create hazardous conditions for kayaks. The cold water temperature of 52°F further exacerbates safety concerns.

extra_notes: high winds make kayak fishing very challenging and unsafe

locations.name: Lafayette River
locations.summary: The Lafayette River offers good kayak fishing conditions on Saturday, with manageable 5-8 mph WNW winds making for calm, protected waters. The low tide at 8:12 AM provides a favorable incoming tide for targeting speckled trout and red drum in the river's bends. Water temperature is 54°F, typical for fall.

extra_notes: good for speckled trout and red drum

locations.name: Lafayette River
locations.summary: Sunday remains a good day for kayak fishing on the Lafayette River due to its sheltered nature, even with NW winds increasing to 7-10 mph. A low tide at 9:01 AM ensures a productive incoming tide period throughout the morning. The 53°F water temperature suggests focusing on deeper holes and structure where fish might congregate.

locations.name: Elizabeth River Jordan Bridge
locations.summary: This location offers good kayak fishing conditions on Saturday, benefiting from sheltered waters and light WNW winds at 5-8 mph. A low tide at 9:00 AM provides an excellent incoming tide for targeting striped bass and red drum. The water temperature is 54°F, typical for the season.

hover_facts.current_speed: 0.4-0.8 knots (can be strong in narrow sections)
extra_notes: industrial area, but good fishing for stripers, red drum

locations.name: Elizabeth River Jordan Bridge
locations.summary: Sunday remains a good option, with the Elizabeth River offering protection from 7-10 mph NW winds. The low tide at 9:49 AM ensures an active incoming tide period during the morning. The 53°F water temperature means fish will be less active, so a slow presentation near structure is advised.

hover_facts.current_speed: 0.4-0.8 knots (can be strong in narrow sections)
extra_notes: good protection, but watch for boat traffic

locations.name: Kiptopeake
locations.summary: Kiptopeake offers okay kayak fishing on Saturday, with a low tide at 7:27 AM providing a good incoming tide for fishing around the wrecks. However, winds at 8-12 mph from the WNW will make this exposed bay location challenging for kayaks. The water temperature is a cool 53°F, suggesting slower fish activity.

extra_notes: good for migratory fish, wrecks nearby

locations.name: Kiptopeake
locations.summary: Sunday is a bad day for kayak fishing at Kiptopeake due to high winds. NW winds of 10-15 mph will create unsafe and extremely challenging conditions in this exposed bay. The cold water temperature of 52°F further increases the risk of hypothermia if capsizing occurs.

extra_notes: high winds make kayak fishing very challenging and unsafe

locations.name: Oyster Boat Ramp
locations.summary: Kayak fishing from Oyster Boat Ramp is okay on Saturday, especially if focusing on the protected marsh creeks. While the low tide at 8:16 AM provides a good incoming tide, the 8-12 mph WNW winds will make open bay areas choppy and exposed. The water temperature is 53°F, suggesting fish may be holding in deeper holes or sun-warmed shallows.

extra_notes: access to productive marsh creeks and flats

locations.name: Oyster Boat Ramp
locations.summary: Sunday is a bad day for kayak fishing from Oyster Boat Ramp, primarily due to high winds. NW winds of 10-15 mph will make open bay and channel areas extremely hazardous and difficult to navigate. Anglers should avoid this location or stick strictly to the most protected, narrow marsh creeks if venturing out in the 52°F water.

extra_notes: high winds make open bay areas difficult, stick to protected creeks

locations.name: Back River Hampton
locations.summary: Back River Hampton offers good kayak fishing conditions on Saturday, with manageable 7-10 mph WNW winds providing some shelter within the river system. The low tide at 8:04 AM allows for a good incoming tide period, which is often productive for marsh fishing. Water temperature is 54°F, requiring anglers to dress warmly.

locations.name: Back River Hampton
locations.summary: Sunday is an okay day for Back River Hampton, with a low tide at 8:53 AM providing a good incoming tide. However, NW winds increasing to 9-13 mph can funnel down the river, creating chop in more exposed sections. The 53°F water temperature means fish will be less active, so targeting deeper channels is recommended.

extra_notes: good protection, but wind can funnel down the river

locations.name: Great Bridge Locks
locations.summary: Great Bridge Locks offers excellent kayak fishing conditions on Saturday due to its very sheltered nature, with light WNW winds at 5-8 mph. This freshwater/brackish system has minimal tidal influence, providing stable water levels. The relatively warmer 56°F water temperature is favorable for bass, crappie, and catfish.

extra_notes: good for bass, crappie, catfish, some stripers

locations.name: Great Bridge Locks
locations.summary: Sunday remains a good day for kayak fishing at Great Bridge Locks, offering excellent shelter from 7-10 mph NW winds. The minimal tidal influence provides stable fishing conditions throughout the morning. The 55°F water temperature is still conducive for freshwater species, making it a reliable choice.
